did.unittitle: United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners of America Local 125 (Utica, NY) Records on Microfilm

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners of America

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners of America, often referred to as the United Brotherhood of Carpenters was formed in 1881. It has grown to be one of the largest trade unions in the United States, and between its chapters and locals there is international cooperation. Local 3211 is based in Herkimer, New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copies of 66 bound volumes on 3 positive microfilm reels. A negative copy is available upon request.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners of America Local 125 (Utica, NY) Records on Microfilm #5810 mf. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
